body:
This PR is not a simple list of all generated suppressions (which in my testing would be very long). It de-dupes the current suppressions, then reduces the additional ones currently generated by ~4x to the minimal entries needed to run valgrind 3.16.0 with `--exit-on-first-error=yes` on Debian 4.19 x86/64. Feedback welcome.

These suppressions allow me to run valgrind without errors on current master for...

test_bitcoin:
```
  valgrind --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all --show-reachable=yes \
           --gen-suppressions=all --error-limit=no -s \
           --suppressions=contrib/valgrind.supp \
           src/test/test_bitcoin --log_level=test_suite
```
bench_bitcoin:
```
  valgrind --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all --show-reachable=yes \
           --gen-suppressions=all --error-limit=no -s \
           --suppressions=contrib/valgrind.supp \
           src/bench/bench_bitcoin -evals=1
```
test_bitcoin-qt:
```
  valgrind --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all --show-reachable=yes \
           --gen-suppressions=all --error-limit=no -s \
           --suppressions=contrib/valgrind.supp \
           src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt --log_level=test_suite
```
and with `make check-valgrind` in PR #17639 which runs them all.
title: test: update valgrind suppressions
